page.title: 11Farming in Brafferton
page.content:
The{European Common Market's}milk policy of controlling output by means of quotas seems to have had little direct impact on the dairy farmers in the Brafferton area. However the {Common Agricultural Policy}has helped to keep up wheat prices and may in the near future encourage the growing of more oil-seed rape.
One amusing example of changing ideas is that about the time of the Second World War many farmers thought that barley would kill cattle if it was used for feed. Now it is ,with silage ,their main fodder.
Another example of change is the increase in{average field sizes}from about 10 acres to between 20 and 30 acres - a typical day's work with modern machinery.
